definition: like wildfire (idiom)/unstoppable
as/as if/such as
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
as/as if/such as
thistle/common sowthistle (Sonchus oleraceus)/bitter (taste)/cruel/flowering grass in profusion

sentences.english: As I write this, bombings and terrorism are ripe.
sentences.chinese: 在我写这篇文章时，爆炸和恐怖活动正如火如荼。

sentences.english: And the flanking operation south of Baghdad is already in full swing.
sentences.chinese: 而且巴格达南部的侧翼行动正如火如荼。

sentences.english: At present, Eco-tourism is in full swing all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 当前，生态旅游正如火如荼地在各地开展。

sentences.english: Since then, school-based curriculum are developing enthusiastically all over the country.
sentences.chinese: 自此校本课程在全国的中小学如火如荼的开展起来。

sentences.english: U. S. combat operations are now at full tilt across the mud-baked flats of Kandahar province in Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 美国在阿富汗坎大哈省平原的战役正如火如荼。

sentences.english: Instructors were trained and big tournaments were organized.
sentences.chinese: 各地培训双节棍教练员，组织武术大赛，如火如荼。

sentences.english: But this year the parties were in full swing again.
sentences.chinese: 但是今年的车展又现如火如荼的场景。

sentences.english: U.S. combat operations are now at full tilt across the mud-baked flats of Kandahar province in Afghanistan.
sentences.chinese: 美国在阿富汗坎大哈省平原的战役正如火如荼。

sentences.english: A national movement to make sure you get sick days at work is catching on.
sentences.chinese: 一项呼吁带薪病假的运动在全国开展得如火如荼。

sentences.english: Would you like some flavors that make your mouth come alive something to let your mouth on fire?
sentences.chinese: 你想让你的嘴变成炒勺吗？五味杂陈，如火如荼。

sentences.english: The private banking business is on a roll.
sentences.chinese: 私人银行业务正发展得如火如荼。

sentences.english: Around the square, various performances of folk artists were also in full swing.
sentences.chinese: 广场四周，各类民间艺人的展演也进行如火如荼。

definition: in full swing (idiom)/(in a) frenzy/buzzing with activity
flourishing and still in the ascendant (idiom); rapidly expanding/still growing strong/on the up
to start shooting or firing/to win an initial success/to succeed (of a plan)
to blossom everywhere/to spring up all over the place/to flourish on a large scale
(fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
to intensify/to speed up/to step up
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
victory reports pour in (idiom); news of success in an endless stream
strong/vigorous/large-scale
upsurge/popular craze
preparations/to get ready for sth
(of competition or fighting) intense/fierce/(of pain) acute/(of an expression of opinion) impassioned/vehement/(of a course of action) drastic/extreme
fig. to rub one's fists and wipe one's palms (idiom)/to roll up one's sleeves for battle/eager to get into action or start on a task
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
just at (that time)/right in (that place)/right in the middle of (doing sth)
unrelenting/without stopping to rest
